Rate this book

Unfinished Hero #1

Knight

Kristen Ashley

3.91
56,635 ratings4,136 reviews
Rate this book
Anya Gage has learned that to get anything good in life, you have to work for it. She has no expectations, no dreams.

Then she finds herself at a party where she doesn’t want to be and she meets Knight.

Knight Sebring knows who he is, what he wants and what he likes. And he gets it. But he never expected something as sweet as Anya Gage to wander into his bedroom during a party he did not expect to be having to borrow his phone.

Knight tries to leave Anya to the life she deserves of white picket fences and a man who watches football on Sundays – good, normal and clean. But when Anya comes to his nightclub and finds herself in a situation, he knows someone has to look after her, he can’t fight it anymore and he decides that man will be him.

Knight teaches Anya that, just as with the bad, in life you should also expect the good. And he teaches her this by giving it to her.

But Knight has a dark past and just as he desires Anya for exactly who she is, he fears when she finds out exactly the man he has become and always intends to be, she’ll leave him for good, normal and clean.

About the author

Kristen Ashley

136 books39.5k followers
Kristen Ashley was born in Gary, Indiana, USA. She nearly killed her mother and herself making it into the world, seeing as she had the umbilical cord wrapped around her neck (already attempting to accessorise and she hadn't taken her first breath!).

Kristen grew up in Brownsburg, Indiana but has lived in Denver, Colorado and the West Country of England. Thus she has been blessed to have friends and family around the globe. Her posse is loopy (to say the least) but loopy is good when you want to write.

Kristen was raised in a house with a large and multi-generational family. They lived on a very small farm in a small town in the heartland and existed amongst the strains of Glenn Miller, The Everly Brothers, REO Speedwagon and Whitesnake (and the wardrobes that matched).

Needless to say, growing up in a house full of music, clothes and love was a good way to grow up.

And as she keeps growing up, it keeps getting better.

5 Stars!

Meet KNIGHT

“Your Christian name is Knight?” 
“If that means first name, yeah.”
 “With a ‘K’”
 “Yeah, babe, with a ‘K’"
“Thats an unusual name.” 
“Yeah.”
 “I kind of like it.” 
“I can die happy.”


And ANYA

“Wars fought over a face like this. A man would work himself into the ground for it, go down to his knees to beg to keep it, endure torture to protect it, take a bullet for it. Poison his brother to possess a face like this.”

Anya first sees Knight at a party. He makes quite an impression. He is tall, dark, and handsome. Masculine features, but obviously angry. Anya is at the party with a friend, ready to leave when her cheap phone dies. She goes to a bedroom, which she assumes is Nick’s to use the phone. And there he is. At first Knight is not too happy to see anyone in his room, but he offers to take Anya home. Not really offers, demands is more like it- but thats just Knight's way.

Knight takes care of Anya from a distance, but one night, she walks into his club. Wearing that dress... and he just couldn’t stay away any longer. Anya is his.
“I find all of this very confusing,” I admitted cautiously.
“You get in my bed, I’ll sort you out.”

Knight is not your normal KA male hero. And I’m more than okay with that! Knight is Possessive. A control freak. A protector. And I love that about him!!!
“I have a new boyfriend. He’s awesome. Protective. And scary. And he regularly freaks me out by being all of those at once.”

He wants Anya. He gets what he wants.
“I don’t live in your world. I live in another world. It’s my world. I took it over. I rebuilt it. I own it. I control it. I have a code. Anyone in my world lives by my code.”

When Knight and Anya are together.... It’s HOT! The other KA books I have read did not have sexy times like this! Wow! Knight is super dominate, controlling hero and it carries over to the bedroom. Their chemistry is explosive, and they have an obvious connection.

“Uh... you don’t fuck Knight. No way. Knight fucks you.”

“You gotta know that every second I spend with you it becomes more and more clear you were made for me. A gift I don’t deserve, didn’t earn but I’m not giving back.”

I loved Knight and Anya together. Anya was sweet, independent, and easy to love. She went out of her way to show Knight how much she cared, and do things for him. With his past, having to protect/take care of everyone, it was nice to see. There were some really sweet moments between the two of them...
“Bottom line, I’m the woman for you, Knight, I was made for you, just as I am. What you don’t get is, you’re the man for me just as you are. I get that honey. And I got it a while ago.”

“Make a wish, Knight.” His eyes moved, roaming my face, down my body, the cake, more of me then back to my eyes.
“Honey, the candles are gonna burn out,” I prompted on a grin.
“Let em’” he replied.
“Got nothin’ I want. Everything I want is standing right in front of me.”

As hot as Knight was, he could be really sweet too! He did have his issues, he was rough around the edges, overly possessive and controlling, but he did it out of love. Wanting to take care of her. He was an all around fantastic hero.
“You love me?”
 “Baby, you were made for me.”

I know everyone had a big issue with the Daddy/Baby thing... I get it, I do- but it worked for me! I felt that it worked for these characters and their relationship. It intensified the book.

Overall, this was my kind of book! A KA hero with issues, a sweet and lovable heroine, hot sex scenes, and an interesting story/plot- whats not to love??? Read this unconventional romance with this unfinished hero! I know I’m looking forward to starting the next one asap :D



First read- 2/2013
Fabulous re-read 8/7/13 with two of my besties Lisa Jayne and Anna! Love you girls xoxo
Another re-read 3/5/14 for my 28th Birthday <3

Ebook pg 54: “What… the fuck… is the matter with you?” he asked slowly, his voice still vibrating, the fury still radiating and I blinked.
What?
I didn't do anything.
And I thought he should know that and not mistake it.
So I yelled it, leaning toward him and everything.
“I didn't do anything!”
He came at me, fast. I retreated, not as fast. I hit something, went into freefall and my bottom landed sideways in a chair, back to a cushioned armrest, legs over the other one. Knight leaned over me, one hand to the top back of the chair, one hand in the seat beside me, face an inch from mine.
God, God, God, he was scaring the hell out of me.
Why was he angry? At me!
“You put on that dress, didn’t you?” he whispered and it was sinister.
“What?” I whispered back.
“You… do not… leave your house… dressed like that… without being on the arm of a man like me,” he ground out on a terrifying staccato with scary pauses.
“A man like you?” I whispered.
“A man who’d shoot another man in the face he even looked at you. Yeah, Anya, a man… like… me.”
He meant that. He meant that. Every word. God, he meant every word of that.
“Knight, you’re scaring me.”
“Good,” he bit out.

Hello Readers.

Call me crazy but I really liked this book.

I mean how many times have you dreamed of a white knight coming to sweep you off your feet??

Slay down dragons for you??

Hmmm...A knight of my own....what I wouldn't do for one!!

But errrr...there's a slight problem!!

Well you see this knight is very,very rough....

1)He can't speak a sentence without using the words f*ck or shit.

2)He is a control freak.Freak as in real freak.

3)His ego is not just the humble size of Texas but whole of North America!!

4)And most importantly he has a DADDY COMPLEX!!


Now let's meet with his baby,Anya---

"Wars fought over a face like this," he murmured like he was talking to himself, my heart stopped beating and his thumbs moved lightly across my cheeks. "A man would work himself into the ground for it, go down to his knees to beg to keep it, endure torture to protect it, take a bullet for it," his eyes came to mine, "poison his brother to possess a face like this."


It all starts with a party....

But before that let me introduce the one who plays the most important role in the story-- A cheap mobile phone.

Oh no,I'm not kidding with you.If this CHEAP phone was not there,they would never have met.


As I was telling you,it all starts with a party.....


Anya was standing in the corner.She did not want to be there.But her friend Sandrine,who's a gold digger,did not want to miss a party thrown by Nick Sebring and dragged her along.

There she saw him for the first time.He was very tall,very handsome and very angry.

"I was a woman and he was the kind of man a woman would look at.Any woman."


But he was gone the next moment.Taking this as a cue,she had to leave alone when Sandrine refused to leave.So she got her coat and was just going to call for a taxi with that cheap phone,when her battery ran out.But there was a phone inside a bedroom which she assumed to be Nick's.She went in and was just going to call for a taxi when she heard a low,smooth,very deep,definitely annoyed man's voice asking,

"What the fuck?"

So,now do you see Readers,why that cheap phone plays the most essential part?

Knight ended up taking her home.He wouldn't take no for an answer.And that marked their beginning---

"Um, I don't know your name but -"
"Knight,"he stated,cutting me off.
"Right, Mr. Knight - "
"No, Knight,"he interrupted me again...
"Thats what I said, Knight," I told him. "Now, Mr. Knight -"
"No, not Mr. Knight. Knight. My name is Knight."
"Your Christian name is Knight?"
"If that means first name,yeah."
"With a K?"...
"Yeah, babe, with a 'K'."

Knight tried to stay away from Anya after that.Though,he made sure that the building she lived in got secured and gave her a brand new,certainly-not-cheap phone,which Anya tried to return.

But all that changed when she arrived at his club and Nick tried to get her alone.

This time he claimed her.

"What...the fuck...is the matter with you?"he asked slowly,his voice still vibrating,the fury still radiating.
"I didn't do anything!"
"You put on that dress, didn't you?"he whispered and it was sinister.
"What?"I whispered back.
"You...do not...leave your house...dressed like that...without being on the arm of a man like me," he ground out.
"A man like you?" I whispered.
"A man who'd shoot another man in the face if he even looked at you. Yeah,Anya,a man...like...me"

And thus he owned her.Body.Heart.And Soul.

---------------------------------------------------------------------

WARNING--This is an unconventional LOVE story.If you are afraid that you won't be getting a hero,then let me assure you,you'll get a hero for sure.

Dark?Egotistical?Crazy?Control freak....yes he is all that.

But he never hurt Anya or anyone else just for the sake of hurting.
His simple rule-You get as good you give!!

"It’s all I know Anya. Protection. I was born then I was raised to be a shield."


The ending will leave you with a warm,fuzzy feeling!!!**sigh**

Just remember,there's someone made for everyone.And Anya was made for Knight.And they fit together perfectly.


That's all for now...

Ta-Ta!!

KristenReviews
845 reviews · 4,996 followers
October 10, 2013
5 stars

I can understand why this book did not work for everyone! I, however, loved reading every page of this story. 

Kristen Ashley gave me what I wanted. She gave me a true anti-hero–one who would challenge what I consider acceptable behavior in my hero. Knight was the type of character who generated, for me, an inner turmoil between my desire for a hero who genuinely loves his heroine (which he did) and my knowledge that he had few, if any, redeeming qualities, and frankly, didn't deserve that heroine.

I could never accept a man like Knight in real life; however, Knight is a fantasy, and, for me, I could look past all his imperfections and fall in love with the love story. If you can do the same, then you will enjoy this story. If you can't, this book probably is not for you. 

If you're already a Kristen Ashley addict, or interested in checking out her books, be sure to stop by our Kristen Ashley Addict's Support Group here on Goodreads!
    5-star anti-hero dark-hero

Michelle [Helen Geek]

April 14, 2012
1 Star

First, an apology. It is not my intent to *bash* this author. She has provided me MANY hours of enjoyment and many characters to love.

I'm conflicted. I did like some things, but it was inconsistent. To say I liked the characters, I did, but then I sincerely didn't like some of the characterizations. Maybe you can help me out..?

To be fair, I'm not a normal BDSM reader, but this was what I'd call BDSM light. It wasn't over the top, so I could hang.

What did I have issues with?
1 -- The whole Baby/Daddy thing. I didn't mind Knight calling Anya baby - an endearment I can handle. I could even buy Anya calling Knight Daddy .. maybe. We all know those sweet little southern ladies who call their husbands Daddy, so okay. Plus, this didn't happen until about 40% of the way through the book, so maybe .. but then during sex. And the insistence of this by Knight and just YUCK!! WTF! I'm mean this was just F**KING WHACKED!! To the point it turned my stomach. The whole book could have done without this. Seriously whacked.
2 -- Ever heard the phrase "some people can justify murder"? Knight has a "stable" of 57 women - prostitutes. He explains this because his mother was a prostitute before meeting "Carl". She had it rough. So, he can take care of these girls, provide protection for a small price, not take "trade" from them. Providin' a service you know. He takes care of these woman. Oldest trade and it will always be around ... blah, blah, blah. WTF!! Seriously, Anya appreciates him taking care of these women and he keeps this separate from her so all good .. right? WHACKED again!
3 -- His absolute rudeness to her in the "name of control". Anya. Here. Now. Go. F**k. Yourself. I say. And she is so, "I love this man". WTF!! I really hope readers reading this realize this sort of rudeness is unacceptable. They don't assume because this is written into a book, by an author they love ... Rudeness in any form or fashion is unacceptable. A total lack of respect. Period.

I bought this book the day/hour it was out. Watching all the back and forth by the other KA fans. This has been my pattern for this authors books. I think I may be a bit more careful in the future.

I did like these characters, until I didn't. I did like this story, until I didn't. I hated how at the very end she threw some sweetness in, when there is no way this can end sweetly.. this guy is still a pimp. He did lose a bit of the rude [see I want to like him..]. I really don't care what these two do in the bedroom; two consenting adults .. blah. And it seriously wasn't bad. What I do mind is the whole "Daddy" thing. Made me feel a voyeur at an incest waiting to happen. Oh, guess what? The sweetness at the end? Was a sweet little baby girl laying in "Daddy's" arms. Sick much?

Remember, this is only my opinion. I do appreciate the author "branching" out into erotica [this would be erotica light]. I appreciate her talent and her need to explore. But, for this reader, there was a boundary crossed, that I seriously hadn't thought would ever be an issue for me reading KA. What a HUGE surprise - me.

I got the uggys.

Read at your own risk.
    a-little-erotica less-than-3 nook-tbr

2.5 stars. Adult review for Erotic content. I can't say I loved everything about the book, but I have to give credit for Knight's ability to talk the clothes off a mannequin. I'll round up to 3 stars for the bedroom voice alone.



Has anyone else ever had an immediate and sudden urge to say a word out loud that you would never say under any other circumstance? And no, I'm not talking swear words.

I seriously think the word "dude" came out of my mouth at least 15 times while reading this book and I'm also pretty sure that I don't use that word on a regular basis. I'm also pretty sure that I'm not a fan of this word.

This was me :

(me saying ) DUDE... (me thinking) wait, what?
(me saying) DUDE... (me thinking) oh no, that did NOT just happen.
(me saying) DUDE... (me thinking) okay, that might actually be hot.

So the story begins...

Independent, finance-strapped woman named Anya finds herself stuck at a high-dollar penthouse party when her phone is unable to get a signal. She heads to the nearest bedroom to find a land line, so she can call a cab.

If you would prefer Anya to call a cab and go home by herself, click here :
If you would prefer Anya to meet a tall, handsome, pissed off man who offers her a ride home, click here :

This new stranger, only known as "Knight," shows an interest in Anya. We enter a place in the book I'd like to call : I can't believe it's not butter Fifty.

If you enjoyed the book Fifty Shades of Grey click here :
If you hated the book Fifty Shades of Grey because of Ana, click here :
If you hated the book Fifty Shades of Grey because of Christian's possessiveness, click here :
If you hated the book Fifty Shades of Grey because Christian had psychological issues, click here :

Knight and Anya hit it off. Each of them fear the other is keeping secrets, so they both try to investigate in order to find out what's going on behind the scenes. However, after Anya starts to ask questions she's told by Knight to stop, so she does. Yet...Knight doesn't seem to stop digging. I wasn't crazy about this part of the story. Even though there was no contract, she accepted demands with hardly any question. Knight took some of his actions (snooping, hovering, demanding she be at places at set times) to a place that could possibly freak most women out.

Even though I'm making a note that the above behavior doesn't do it for me...I'm going to disclaimer that we are working with a romance that imo straddles the realm of mainstream contemporary and BDSM erotica. Different genre = different rules. People often read erotica to have their kinky itches scratched. Some people love the D/s system outside of the bedroom and might find Knight to be their perfect book hero. I prefer my D/s to be sexual ONLY, with the relationship outside of the bedroom conducted as equal partners in every aspect. Anyway, there's your warning, so you know what you're getting into.

Our couple develops a very close and loving relationship - suprised? I was. As mentioned earlier, Knight may be dominant but he adores his Anya. The high point of this book was the way he worshipped his woman. I am also awarding Knight a highly coveted "Dirty Talker" award. I thought Flynn from Willing Victim had it going on, but that man has just been dethroned. If nothing else, I would read the book if you love a man who can talk about what he loves while he's giving it to you. This man is on fire!!! He had me at, "want to own your body and beauty," and whatever else he was saying in the bedroom as I was in my giddy female reading state. Yes, please.

On to the "terms of endearment."

Do you like the use of such terms as baby, daddy, etc.?
Do you hate the aforementioned terms?

Other random points :

Are you okay with a bad boy who might in fact do bad things when it comes to business or skirting the law? If yes :
If the answer is no :

The ending...

Do you want a happy ever after? (HEA) If yes :
Don't care? .


Final analysis :

This was my first KA book. Apparently, I picked one of the wilder ones to start with, as this is less mainstream than some of her other works. I will be trying out one of her more "mainstream" books to see how I like her other work.

My opinion :

Pros - Great bedroom domination, man who is a loving caregiver, sexual variety and epic dirty talk.
Cons - A man who wanted to control too much of the woman's personal life outside of the bedroom, which is so not my thing. Also, I was a bit confused by this woman who had a spine in some areas yet accepted things without question in others, which was sort of a contradiction. I think it was explained that she found out being a sub sort of turned her crank, and if so, this probably shouldn't bother me...but it kind of does.

March 6, 2014
FIVE 'THE DADDY' STARS

“You don't need to like me to let me fuck you but since I like you, I'd prefer it that way.”



CAUTION a word of warning, do not proceed with this book if you are offended by any kind of over domineering, deliciously tempting alpha characters. This book would more than likely not be for you, however luckily for me I love, love, loved every page and gladly spent my time with this dangerous hero. 'Knight' is the kind of book that puts yourself in an anxious state waiting for your next spare time to read. For my reading tastes there was nothing not to love, this Novel is a lively eye opener and fabulously entertaining read. I've now crowned Kristen Ashley as my fairy-book-godmother as I'm sure she waved her literary magic Wand over me as I was reading this book. This story boasts my favourite 'book husband' to date and is most confidently one of my most treasured alpha stories, here are the rest of my 'I love the daddy' book thoughts ...

What's it all about?
Knight Sebring is a tall, brooding, strong, dangerous but overprotective and devilishly handsome business man. He is ruthless with all his endeavours and stops at nothing to get what he wants out of life. When Anya Gage walks into his life a relationship of epic proportions ensues where the test of time and love is battled out between two hearts. Secrets, shock reveals and uncertainty mean this love is challenged at every turn but this alpha is determined to make this love his forever.



What did I love?
I've already sat at the book confessional and declared this book as a favourite of mine, so here are some of the reasons why; 'Knight' is full of Tantalisingly good chapter titles, which are bursting with great story telling and descriptive scenes. Kristen Ashley provides her readers with male characters to die for and Knight is no exception, be prepared to be shocked and fall in love, Mr Sebring is not a character to be missed, with every amazing male we hope to find an equally loveable heroine to fall in love with and I believe that the author delivered just that in this story. I found the relationship between the pair refreshingly original and believable. I can't deny that I love a well rounded story of a bad boy and good girl falling helplessly in love and Kristen Ashley showcases that perfectly here. I don't think I'll ever tire of this genre of book, if authors continue to write them, i'll read them. Knight Sebring's name should be next to the dictionary definition of swoon, he is undoubtedly a love him or loathe him character, he won't be hitting everyone's favourite lists but he's certainly on the top of my Christmas wish list this year. This couple are now a firm favourite of mine, I loved the chemistry and connection that Kristen ashley created right from chapter one and I want everyone to fall in love with this story right alongside me.



Final thoughts ...
This book was all kinds of right and all of the best kinds of wrong, I could not get enough of this story, and felt a tad bereft when I turned that final page. Life can be messy, hurtful, hard, heartbreaking, love isn't always perfect, people make mistakes and wrong choices, 'Knight' wraps all of above up in one gorgeously addictive story and shows that ultimately when two people are meant to be - it just works. 'Knight' was my first book by Kristen Ashley and I'm 100% sure it will not be my last, her writing style had me hooked. A stunning beginning, an entertaining middle and an epilogue that was the icing on the cake. You would be crazy to miss out, go grab it readers ... Kisses.



*Originally devoured in January, taken for another 'spin' as a re-read with the girls in August 2013, now read for the third time March 2014.*
    love-you-forever-and-ever

May 4th, 2013

Pre-reveal of the paperback cover for KNIGHT!



Review:


Knight is the first book in Kristen Ashley's new erotic romance series, The Unfinished Heroes and I totally loved it!

Knight Sebring is your typical KA male, but rather than a hero, Knight is an anti-hero. Über alpha, super sexy, over the top controlling... and very, very bad. Knight is the kind of hero you expect to see redeemed in his own story, but that doesn't happen and ya know what? I don't care. I adore him just the nasty way he is! Oh, and a dirty talker, too!! Man, oh, man! What a mouth... a mouth he can use on me any and every day of the week!!! He can be my "Daddy" if I can be his baby.

Anya Gage... what a great heroine! Independent, strong, hard working... she's had a rough life but hasn't let it stop her from reaching for her dreams. She's loving, compassionate, and one of my favorite women from any KA novel!!

A word to those who might be interested.... While this is definitely hotter than any of KA's mainstream novels, those like me who read quite a lot of erotica might consider this a little lighter than most books in the erotic genre. There are BDSM elements, but nothing extreme, though there are some very hot punishment scenes involving spanking with the hand and a strap.

I'm so, so excited about this new series and can't wait to read more!!!

Shall keep this short and simple.

I LOVE THIS BOOK

My first KA, I re read it about 5 times before I decided to check out anything else the author had wrote. Also the book I decided to get in paperback format to get signed by KA herself.

Love love love Knight.

Are some people going to have issues with the "daddy" thing? Probably

Are they going to have issue with his profession? - Yes

Are they going to have issue with his views on marriage? - yes.

But, I had no issues with any of it. I can see how Knight's upbringing and experiences lead him to doing what he does, and thinking how he does about that.

And the marriage thing - I reckon Anya is more secure in the love that she knows Knight feels for her than a lot of married couples.

The more I re read, the more I love it, and Knight even has an odd vulnerability. He is possessive, controlling, but he needs Anya, more than she needs him it seems, and he makes it so clear that he loves her.

4 stars. 5 stars. 2 stars. 1 star.... I guess that makes 3? It doesn't feel right to give it 3, but that kind of is the middle ground of my feelings.



If you like controlling men, this is the book for you!! If not, you may wish to stay away...

This is the darker side of KA! In case you have not read any of her books before, you should know that most of them are NOT like this. Pleeease dont judge her books based on this one!!

I'd been putting this book off for a while because I knew there were a lot of controversial things in it that I was really worried I wouldn't be okay with them. And in the end, as much as it hurts my heart to say it, I wasn't okay with them.... but, and here's the weird thing... I actually still really liked the story. Despite hating certain parts of it. I know that's weird, but there's nothing I can do about it.

Beware. This book makes me a little ranty... consider yourselves warned :P

"Um, I don't know your name but -"
"Knight,"...
"Right, Mr. Knight - "
"No, Knight," ...
"Thats what I said, Knight," I told him. "Now, Mr. Knight -"
He...turned his eyes to me...
"No, not Mr. Knight. Knight. My name is Knight." ...
"With a K?"...
"Yeah, babe, with a 'K'."...
That's an unusual name."...
"Yeah," he agreed...
"I kinda like it," ...
"I can die happy"

When Anya stumbles into Knight's bedroom one night at a party she doesn't want to be at and that he doesn't even want in his house, he informs her that he's going to take her home. No questions. He's unlike anyone she's ever met - pissed, scary, bossy, controlling, insanely sexy, yet utterly protective and caring. Days later she can't get him out of her head. He's in her dreams, her thoughts, her mind... In many ways, they are polar opposites, in many ways they are perfect for each other, but either way, they are both unquestionably drawn to each other and so begins their unconventional romance.

As terrifyingly scary controlling as Knight came off as first, I actually, oddly enough, kinda fell instantly love with him. He radiated protectiveness. I loved that about him. And when he told her she should feel safe with him, I totally believed him. I felt safe with him, which is weird, I know considering I'm the reader, but you get what I mean...

"What...the fuck... is the matter with you?" ...
What? ...
"I didn't do anything!" ...
"You put on that dress, didn't you?"...
"What?"...
"You... do not... leave your house... dressed like that... without being on the arm of a man like me," he ground out...
"A man like you?" I whispered back.
"A man who'd shoot another man in the face he even looked at you. Yeah, Anya, a man... like... me"

**SHIVERS**

Everything about Knight screamed opulence, power, control . He was such an oxymoron of a character. Both a gentleman and a jerk. Rough and yet never cruel. He was no knight in shining armor. More like a dark, scary knight. But one that you knew without a doubt would go to the ends of the world and back to keep harm from those he loved. He was a bossy, seriously controlling , sophisticated Alpha caveman. He knew who he was and what he wanted and wasn't going to play games to get them.

Throughout the whole book, even throughout all my issues (about which I will go into detail in a moment), I never, ever, not even once, doubted that his heart was in the right place. He was an anti-hero. Gorgeous. Flawed. Protective. Fuckhot. Dominant. Truly an "unfinished hero".

“It’s all I know Anya. Protection. I was born then I was raised to be a shield."

Just like with his dialogue (which I loved, by the way), everything about him was clipped, efficient, and yet strangely heart warming.

"Wars fought over a face like this," he murmured... "A man would work himself into the ground for it, go down to his knees to beg to keep it, endure torture to protect it, take a bullet for it..."
Oh.
My.
God.
"Knight," I breathed.
"You are not walkin' away from me."

Anya, I loved. She was independent, took care of herself, was very down-to-earth and appreciated the little things in life. I loved that despite her tragic back-story, she didn't let that consume her life and had found a way to move on positively.... I think that, in the end, Knight could have learned a bit from her.

Its weird but I was kind of bracing myself going into this book... I knew about the "Daddy" thing (I'll go into more detail in a second) and I was honestly almost preparing myself not to like Knight and had all my defensive shields up ready to kind of hate him, but I honestly couldn't stop myself from totally falling head over heels in love with him. Especially in the first half of the book, he made me tingle...

The hotness between them was explosive!! Their chemistry was strong, but very subtle. No in-your-face instant declarations of love, but it didn't mean you couldn't absolutely FEEL their connection and what they felt for each other.

I was in 5 star LOVE with the story until the 40% mark... then things started to get difficult for me and really pushed the limits of my comfort zone. I loved Knight's character and I kept trying to breathe deeply and not be judgmental but by 42%, I was NOT okay with the things he was saying.

I'll admit, up till that point, I was wondering what all the fuss about this book was about but at that point I was STRONGLY feeling the need to dash my Kindle against the wall and put the book down. He was just WAY too over-the-top controlling. I kept fighting to stay in love with him and just had to remove myself from the story a little.

I took a breather for a few hours and then dove back it. I had fallen in love with his character enough that I wanted to know why he was the way he was. And he promised that he'd tell so I stuck with the story... I was having this extreme love/hate relationship with him and was totally sympathizing how Anya was feeling:

"You scare me, confuse me, freak me out and you're also sweet so I don't know what to do with you." ....
"You get in my bed, I'll sort you out."

I'll lay it out. He's into punishments. Not random cruelty, but if she does something he doesn't like, he spanks her with his hand or strap. Personally, I'm reallllly not into that. Big turn off for me despite the fact that I can admit that scenes where they are written can be really hot but its the concept of them that rubs me way the fucking wrong way. Like WAAAAY wrong. But I had to realize that it wasn't about whether or not I liked it. Clearly Anya did, so again... I just tried to open my mind and accept it. She was happy. He was happy... ok.

With him, it wasn't about kink. It was purely about control. His back story does come out later to explain it but I was still thanking God for small favors when I read this: "I am not into kink, animals, candle wax... knives, blood, needles, clamps, strangulation, and definitely not any shit that goes beyond that." *WHEW* Good to know! ... (I'm sorry, animals???? That was even an ﻿option?? ﻿ok, I'm getting side tracked... back to the review)

The depth of their feeling for each other was beautiful but during those punishment scenes, I felt like there was a wall between me and the story because even though I was trying hard not to judge, some of the stuff just was just so not appealing to me that it kept me a little removed even though I really cared for the story. Gah! That sounds weird even to me!

So I kinda fought my feeling about him... I'd get into a point where I thought I could be okay with everything, but then he'd do or say something that would literally make me cringe away from my kindle in disgust..... "Who owns you?" really? REALLY??? OWNS?? ok... trying to remind myself that Anya likes it :| *deep breath*

And lets not forget the big elephant in the room regarding this book:
The "Daddy" issue.
For those of you who don't know, I'll lay it out. In the bedroom, he calls her "my baby" (which on its own is sweet), but he also has her call him "Daddy".... the combination of the two was NOT. OKAY. with me.
I never got over my issue with it. I cringed every time I read it. I'm sorry to say that it really creeped me way-the-freaking-hell out. It just felt so WRONG. I'm sorry, I try my best not be judgmental in life, but it just made me want to gag, vomit and put the book down.

It was just too much for me. Example:
"My baby wants her Daddy." Ewwwww *shudders* WHY?? Ugh.
"Ride your Daddy." "Yes, Daddy." Nononono!!! God. YUK!!
Here's another "hold onto Daddy's cock". I'm sorry, but that made me physically ill. I don't even want to THINK about those two words in the same sentence. EVER. Fucking gross.... I just kept trying to remind myself of how sweet he was when he wasn't calling himself her Daddy. I loved his character, I really did. He was so sweet and Alpha and adored her but still...just EWWWWW!!

And let it be clarified... it wasn't the Daddy thing alone that bothered me. I could have probably gotten used to that. It was the fact that it was combined with "my baby". Its kind of impossible for me to read that and not have my mind go to places it really did NOT want to go.

Slight spoiler in regards to the Daddy thing but VERY important regarding the most important reason why I wasn't okay with it :

But the thing was that Knight was not an ass. God, his moments of sweet and loving warmed my heart every time right up to the point where I pretty much would forget all my issues with him. He cared for and loved Anya SO deeply. I just had to accept that his way of showing it and his world were different. Seriously, when he wasn't grossing me out, I really, really loved him!!

"I love you, Anya, you're the only woman who's had that from me and you're the only one who ever will."

Interestingly, there is no 90% freakout moment in this, like with most KA books. Instead, there is a big revelation about Knight that comes out, and I know it was pretty controversial, but oddly enough I was totally fine with it. He explained the reason behind it and that was good enough of an explanation for me to totally accept it.

A lot of things about Knight made me want to gag, cringe, and shudder... but a lot of things about him made me melt, warmed my heart and had me fanning myself... And I really LOVED both Knight and Anya's characters for a whole number of reasons and despite my occasional gagging, it was a really good book. I don't know if that makes any sense, but its the truth. Knight and Anya were undeniably perfect for each other. They completed each other, found peace in each other, and loved each other with all their hearts. That part was beautiful. And, at the end of the day, that's what matters most, right?

I had a few issues with how the book ended and where Knight ended up as a character. I guess he really was an Unfinished Hero in the end. One who cared strongly, deeply and undeniably for what was his. But I wished he's have changed just a bit more. You know, sometimes change is growth. And just because a person is the way they are, doesn't mean a little improvement would be a bad thing and it doens't mean they are giving up who they are. I think that's a lesson he would have done well to take to heart.

**SLIGHT SPOILER ALERT IF YOU READ ON**

1) It was written in the epilogue that their daughter was curled up on her "Daddy's" chest. WHAT. THE. FUCK ?!? I spent the book trying to square myself with the idea that, to them, Daddy didn't mean father and was a term of endearment... So I figured that for sure if they had kids, he would always be Dad, not Daddy, so WHY WAS IT USED IN THAT CONTEXT????? Arrrgh, that, I cannot square myself with. Ewwww. Gag. Barf.

2) I didn't like how he never accepted celebrating Christmas. I understand why he is the way he is as a person. It makes sense... But I wished he'd had changed more. He was just too rigidly set in his ways. No Christmas??? C'mon. WTF? I'm not Christian and even I celebrate Christmas - tree, presents, music, food and all. It's a beautiful holiday, a time to be with family, share love, make memories. I think it would have made him grow a lot as a person if he could have learned to appreciate that. And what about his kids?? Was he planning on being the Grinch for eternity?? grrrrrrr
**EDIT: okay, so someone told me that apparently, on a thread somewhere, KA said that Knight would actually celebrate Christmas with his kids. Ok. That's amazing, and I'm very happy he would have gotten to that point. BUT, I'd have wished he'd gotten to that point in the epilogue somewhere so we could have seen his character growth. Cuz without knowing that, it didn't make me look too favorably on him in that respect and not everyone would know about that little comments made on a thread somewhere.

Oh, Knight... I want to love you. I DO love you. You just make it so hard at times...

5 Re-Read Unlimited Times Stars
* * * * * Spoiler Free
June 13, 2021-So with all that has been happening in life, sometimes you have to go back and revisit what you know, what you feel sure of and that is what I did. Worked through At Peace and then transitioned to Knight and now reading Lady Luck. I do not know where this endeavor is going to take me next but there is a peace in knowing whichever book I pick up from the Vintage group of KA, I will be ok.

Re-Read 2015
There are book men who are so fully formed, they radiate off the pages. They come at you with a power that transcends reading and you feel them before you have read much about them. Yes, there will be a description; details of eyes, hair and build. There will be clothing and ways of moving... whether they are purposeful in their gate or just kind of get to the object of their desire in a rush. All of these details, of course, round out the mental image of the man... but with some, they aren't entirely necessary... and that's because these men come to us... tapping into every physical and mental sense we have...like a subliminal message or call...they are there and we know them.

Knight is one of those men. Air shifts. He has a force field and those around him sense him coming. This is not superhero bullshit... this is a dynamic, controlling, powerful man. If you think this is only in books, ask any female if this type of awareness is possible; every single one of them will tell you, yes....and their eyes will glaze over... they may not have actually interacted with one... but somewhere in their lives... they ran across one and the impact and wishing... still can be recalled.

This book is a testimony to overcoming horror of all types. He... dealt with situations which marked him to his core... shaped him to protect those he loved and weaker in society. He was smart...old beyond his years... saw too much for a child's vision; so he became a man before his time. It set his path. He appreciated the good that came to him; held on and used what was given him... and made the decision early never to be in a position of others' control again... whether in work or life... He bided his time.... looking for opportunities and then made his moves.
Created his world... and those in it learned... You did as Knight instructed. He was loyal, decisive, very smart, and direct.

The other person in this world is Anya. It would be easy to think she is this woman who was not up to the level of Knight. She had had her own living hell after only being with her parents for seven years... they were killed together in a random carjacking...leaving her to be raised by a cruel and lazy aunt. Yet, Anya had developed an inner strength... recognizing early on... life can be what you make it... you take what is given and figure out a way to make it better somehow. And bless her... she was in the process of doing just that. She was careful with her money; had a business goal and stuck to it no matter what. She had a concrete vision of the goal and worked every day to make it happen. She was extremely smart about her likes/dislikes and worked to create her own ways and style without overthinking it. She understood.... this was her life... there was no safety net or person coming to the rescue... she was it and lived accordingly.

These two meet through circumstances which could happen in anyone's life... a party, a need to make a call for a taxi. Yet, due to who Knight was and how the situation presented to him... with other surrounding factors... he took it upon himself to intervene and drive her home. Anya becoming an excuse for Knight to collect himself and leave the environment pissing him off is scooped up/ moved along and reasoned with to allow Knight to do this action.

Was she weak when she didn't stick to her first inclination to say no... or the second time when she explained why it wasn't necessary.... or the third when she tried to insist... no, because as you can see she was trying to reason with him as to why she didn't need him to do it. What developed into a pattern and made this relationship as perfect as it was ... was... she would listen to how he would counter her reasons for something.... and inevitably, Knight would have an answer that made sense... He saw money was tight by her clothes.. not the taste but the quality... he knew the taxi cost would be a hit; he also told her she would be helping him by allowing him to drive off the steam. These were legitimate reasons... also... she sensed the man he was... and at that moment, a decision was made and she went with him.

It is through this pattern that developed between the two of them we get to follow her thought process... get to hear her mind racing... feeling all of the changes and adjustments. At first... it may feel like she is overwhelmed... and there are moments of that... but as the relationship between them develops... Anya develops more of her understanding of who she is, what she is attracted to... and how Knight is ticking boxes she didn't know she had to tick. Knight also has opened her eyes to how others see her... the reality of her... the beauty of her and how she had no idea about this.

Knight sees Anya for the miracle she is... unassuming; open, loyal and never expecting anything from anyone. He gives her things and she tries to return them... he makes things easier and she is appreciative... he feeds her.... doesn't make a move on her... and she wishes he did.

All of this leads up to him laying it out for her... his ways...rules... need for control and punishment with always taking care of her after. He breaks it down, the process by process... makes sense to her internal thoughts and there is also that tingle which keeps curling within her when he talks about all of it. These two finally connect and when they do, we are there... learning and understanding Knight just like Anya... nothing is left to the imagination... and we are either on board... or we should go... yet... the decision was made from the start... we went with him in his car... through his club... and to his home... we went with him because we know he would never hurt us through Anya... because he has shown his sweet... and it is sooooooo good.

Being with Anya and Knight is a special type of beauty... it is not conventional... it is not something everyone will be comfortable with and that is totally ok... but if you can see your way through to these people and why they are who they are and how perfect they are together... then you will get to experience love on a level few get...whether in books, movies or in your own life... and the thing about this type of love... you do not have to have the money or status that the book has to feel it... you just need to be open to being accepting your partner fully for who they are and love them for it.

Knight is special... but Anya makes him more so... and it is the coming together of these two which grabs your heart and soul.

KA took a risk when she went on this journey a few years ago... she has since added to this series with Creed and Raid. She has stated another Unfinished Hero is in the works... hopefully, we will get him soon.

5 stars – Contemporary Erotic Romance

This is Kristen Ashley’s first venture into the “erotic” romance genre, and I loved it! Knight Sebring is a seriously sexy, magnetic, dark anti-hero and all kinds of yummy “Dom”ineering alpha hotness. Anya Gage is very likeable and genuine and one of my favorite KA heroines. I really enjoyed their captivating, intense connection, dynamic relationship, emotional progression, and explosive bedroom scenes! YOWZA!

Ms. Ashley took a gamble with this, and I imagine some readers/fans will be put off by certain aspects, like the BDSM (D/s) elements and Knight’s dark side. He’s definitely an enigmatic, powerful “anti-hero”, but that’s one of the things I loved most about it. And I’ve read quite a bit of erotic and BDSM romances, so for me, this is actually on the somewhat lite/mild side, but it’s still gratifyingly steamy!

Controversy and Quibbles:

1) Spank Me Daddy

Knight had Anya answer/call him “Daddy” instead of “Master” or “Sir” in their sex play, which usually sets off my ick factor alert, but it really didn’t bother me in this. Somehow Knight mastered it, and I actually found this “Daddy” more smokin’ hot than creepy. “Come to/for Daddy?” If/when it’s Knight Sebring demanding it? Oh Hell Yeah!

2) I’m No Mr. Nice Guy...aka...Knight’s Big Secret



3) HEA But Knight Isn’t Traditional



Overall, I’m a very satisfied Kristen Ashley fangirl and sincerely hope she pens more erotic romances! 5 stars!

Favorite Knight quotes:

“Wars fought over a face like this,” he murmured like he was talking to himself, my heart stopped beating and his thumbs moved lightly across my cheeks. “A man would work himself into the ground for it, go down to his knees to beg to keep it, endure torture to protect it, take a bullet for it,” his eyes came to mine, “poison his brother to possess a face like this.”

“And I wake up happy, baby, because I possess beauty and I own that beauty in all the forms it can take and the least important of those are physical.”

3 STARS! ★★★



“You don’t fuck Knight. No way. Knight fucks you.”

Well this day came sooner than I thought as I've officially popped my KA cherry, woohoo! Y'all can thank my blog wife, Allison who pulled a dirty one on me to get me to pick this one up. Note to self: Do not mess with Allison when it comes to Kristen Ashley, this woman loves her KA fix. Having Knight being one of her all time book husbands, naturally I had to meet him myself to see what's the fuss all about.

All I can say is that Knight is the definition of ultimate Alpha-male with a capital A. I'm super positive that in all of my reading experience, no one can probably top him in this department. Grade A possessive, dominant alpha male who is an absolute control-freak that will go all full-on protective mode on the woman he loves.

I'm not gonna lie, that's pretty damn hot to read about. Also I found Knight to be a rather amusing character because he came off like an oxymoron; caveman-like but yet such a gentleman. He can be an arse but still be a sweetheart. In a way, that makes him rather swoon-worthy because who doesn't want a man packed with helluva testosterones to utter goddamn sweet words to the woman he cares about deeply? Yup I get it now Allison, he's a keeper for sure ;)



So the thing about this book...well I didn't hate it but I didn't love it either. There were just so many little things that bugged me throughout. I thought the first half of the book piqued my interest with this thing going on between Anya and Knight but having read more on later, all I got was a pretty routined life of them going at each other. I'm not even gonna talk about how this was almost instalove at its best with Knight being fixated with Anya within minutes of finding her in his room. Or how Anya somehow willingly does every single thing he says when she barely knows him. There were some minor drama scenes that got thrown into the mix but it just left me feeling all meh about it.



My major struggle would definitely be the dialogue between both Anya and Knight, especially Knight. His slang(?) or clipped sentences drove me completely nuts till at some point, I kinda gave up trying to decipher his sentences. It was a whole lot of weirdly structured sentences with multiple commas and throw in several f-bombs in between.

Apparently I've been told that this is a common thing in KA's alpha males, so maybe it needs to take quite some time getting used to. Also there were just a whole lot of 'babe' and 'honey' being thrown back and forth, can't exactly say those are my cuppas in the endearment department.

And now to address the big elephant in the room, those who may or may not know about this particular book or dare I say, a usage of a peculiar term. Yup it's that baby/Daddy thing. Personally I didn't find it to be a complete turn-off but I wasn't a fan of it either because I just found it to be so...out of place? It's like one of those moments where I read a scene and all of a sudden this comes up -> that had me going "Did that just REALLY happened?" and I'd be having this incredulous look trying to take it all in. It was just all kinds of weird for me but I can see how it'll work for some people.



But the steam though, WOWZA. KA sure as hell can write some might fine sex scenes that would be hazardous to all Kindles alike. Added on with an ultimate alpha male and dirty talker like Knight, a precaution would surely be required.

The revelation at the end, well I can't say that I'm shocked by it. It does leave me a little iffy with how Anya seemed to be rather complacent about finding out the truth and just let the matter pass without much ado. I probably got it that the reveal of Knight's true nature is what makes up the anti-hero part of him but perhaps it would have left a bigger impact had it been uncovered much earlier in the read.

But I still want to applaud the author for making Knight an anti-hero through and through. He was unapologetic of the way he is and just laid it all out for Anya to accept and love him for who he truly is.

“You gotta know that every second I spend with you it becomes more and more clear you were made for me. A gift I don’t deserve, didn’t earn but I’m not giving back.”



Overall I'm rather indifferent about this one. Sorry Allison and to all my KA ladies who loved this!! :( I tried and while I did enjoy it at some parts, perhaps this just wasn't really for me. However I do have a knack for her badass alpha males, so I'll definitely be checking out her other series still :) Keep the KA recs coming! ♥

Knight is the first book in the Unfinished Hero series and can be read as a standalone.

1.5 stars

omg hell has finally frozen over! this book actually made me wanna hate on KA. i think i need a recovery period before i can pick up another KA book.

listen folks, ive read 50+ KA books at this point. i have, but NEVER, rated her books below 3 stars. EXCEPT for At Peace, which i gave 2.5 stars (rounded down to 2). now, this one will go down as the first KA book i ever gave the lowest rating to.

Not my kinda hero, even saying hero feels wrong in association with Knight.

Yeah we get told how he got the way he is and why but FUDGE that, cause it’s a cop out not an explanation.

He is a “my way or the highway” type of guy. They only have a HEA because she accepts everything about him. Some might say : isn’t that what love is? Hmm, no. Love is a compromise not a selfish, one man act.

Don’t wanna get married? - That’s fine cause I don’t really need to, although it’s been my dream since forever. But your reasons for not wanting to, are so viable and make so much sense, and considering how much you love me I’m gonna give in to you. I’ll always long for this thing you won’t give me while I watch my friends live out my dreams but well, it makes total sense for you to not want this even though you plan to live the rest of your life with me and have numerous kids. As I said, makes total sense.

Want me to be like a human doll when the mood strikes, cause you enjoy control and commanding me on what and when to do stuff? It makes you feel like a man and if I don’t get on board you’re out (your total love and devotion pooof disappears, makes sense) I must have missed the part where you ask me if I have some kink/fetish that I like cause all I hear is you you you. But that’s okay cause I can give you all that because we love each other and that’s what you need.

Wanna tell me what I can and cannot wear because any live d**k in the vicinity might be getting all bothered by my outfit choice which reveals too much of me/my body that actually belongs to me?

What was the question again? Oh yeah please do instruct me on my outfit choices and let me know when I’m allowed to have a drink or dance because those are not choices that should be made independently by a mature female but rather they need pre approval——— otherwise your nether regions will not get excited by your complete control over my life, body and choices——

Lastly, to hell with the last few decades of female empowerment and all that jazz, as a modern woman I get to choose and I choose to do and be who you command, because that makes you happy, and I love you, and I know that’s your way of loving me too..

I shall conclude this was kinda gross, but I’ve read worse hence the 2 stars.

This is NOT a good depiction of a Dom/Sub relationship or whatever this wanted to be. Knight was a control freak and that control invaded Anya’s life. She always deferred to him, and not just in the bedroom.

It’s as if being with him comes with a set of conditions that apply to all areas of life. If she doesn’t behave the way he wants and adjusts her expectations then he’s out. That’s not love, that’s sad, beyond sad.. it actually reminds me so much of real faulty relationships where one partner sort of denounces their personhood in other to adhere to the image and idea the other wants in their life. I say no one is worth that. Not in fiction and not in real life.

This book failed. And the worse thing is that the problematic aspects are not in your face, it lures you in with the promise of an alpha type hero, sprinkles some kinky sex on top(which by the way, wasn’t even good) and blinds you to the very real issues that this sick relationship has.

This might be fiction peeps, but reality is always worse..

He mentions several times she was the kind of woman men bend over backwards for and yet he wouldn't bend. I struggled with that. 1st Read: Knight is my first book by Kristen Ashley and I get what all the hype is about now. I've had so many people tell me I need to read her books, it's crazy. I'm a huge fan of strong alpha Hero's and Knight is definitely that.

The only reason I gave this book 4 stars instead of 5 is that while I loved that Knight was THAT alpha, his expectation of Anya to completely bend to his will 100% if she wanted to be with him felt wrong in some instances. Yes, I love the controlling, dominant men but I also want them to love their woman enough to want to give on the small issues that really shouldn't be issues. They're small and don't matter in the scheme of things, so if you love your woman, do it for her.

That's my only complaint. I loved everything else about this book. I listened to the audio and loved the narrator. She did a really good job. I'm never a big fan of woman impersonating men's voices so I do wish they would have a man and woman do the narration but it's a small issue.

Knight by Kristen Ashley


Erotic, Captivating and Emotional, Kristen Ashley wrote a hot, possessive, controlling Alpha antihero that you’ll adore and a fierce, strong yet submissive woman that brings him to his knees.


I’m a huge Kristen Ashley fan, I read and LOVED many of her books, they’re my go to during reading slumps and bookish hangovers. Mystery Man sits comfortably on my list of TOP Book Boyfriends and Husbands, so naturally I expected a lot out of Knight but at the same time I was nervous because she said that this series is different than her other books, as in darker and more erotic.


Well, let me tell you Knight did not disappoint! I had butterflies in my stomach and my heart was pounding while reading this book, I LOVED it!




“Wars fought over a face like this,” he murmured like he was talking to himself, my heart stopped beating and his thumbs moved lightly across my cheeks. “A man would work himself into the ground for it, go down to his knees to beg to keep it, endure torture to protect it, take a bullet for it,” his eyes came to mine, “Poison his brother to possess a face like this.”



Swooooon ♥♥


Knight was not a bad boy. He was a bad man he knew who he was, what he wanted and what he liked. And he got it. Period. Law and society be damned. He made his own rules and morals.


I loved him to pieces, I disliked some of his choices in life namely his profession BUT that’s what makes the ANTI in antihero. By no means was he a good normal citizen but he loved Anya and his past justified his actions.


Tortured with a dark past that he keeps secret, he tries to stay away from Anya so she can get the normal life she deserves with the white picket fence and 2 point O kids. But he ends up getting drawn to her and eventually he caves in and decides to be her man.


Knight was very controlling to the point where he dictated what she should wear where she can go and who she associates with. Their relationship has a touch of BDSM. When she disobeyed he punished her (Spanking and such) so if you’re not comfortable with that fair warning.


Anya a strong independent woman, was abandoned many times during her short life so she had insecurities and she learned that the only person she can count on is herself, she had her little dream and worked day and night to achieve it. She didn’t expect handouts and refused them when Knight offered. When they got together she became very submissive, she didn’t let go of her dream but she allowed Knight to help her.


Their relationship was very endearing, he treated her as his queen and she as her king, they loved each other deeply and it showed through their words, actions and thoughts. There were no stupid misunderstandings, they communicated very openly with each other which I loved.


The secondary characters were very well developed I loved Vivicia, Anya’s best friend, she was so badass and fierce! I would have loved for her to get a book but she already got her happy ending in this one. The trademark Kristen Ashley Language was there as was the great banter!




“Men understand direct communication. It's bitches who speak in code.”



There was ONE thing that bothered me very much but I eventually got used to it or just pretended it wasn’t there lol I know very mature of me. I’ll put it in the spoiler section because I’m very anti-spoiler even the little things count. It’s about what they call each other during sex.

“You’re perfect, baby.”
I blinked. Then I whispered, “Knight – “
“No, Anya, no fucked up shit outta that sweet mouth. I’m not gonna listen to it and I’ll work my balls off, I don’t care if it takes decades, to make you stop even thinkin’ it. Instead, you gotta know that every second I spend with you it becomes more and more clear that you were made for me. A gift I don’t deserve, didn’t earn but I’m not giving it back.”





Overall it was 4++ Stars read for me. Definitely recommend it!  You’ll keep turning the pages no doubt!

Now Kristen Ashley's writing was absolutely delicious! What I liked the most was how she gives every detail, every word an importance. Sometimes books lack words to describe the way you feel when you enter a room, when you are in a particular situation. But with KA, it's certainly not the case! It's like you are in the book and in the hero or heroine's head, you see with their eyes.
In the same aspect, the sex scenes smoking hot! Once again, as a couple Knight and Anya are perfect! They respond to each other in an incredible way. The attraction, the combination of want and need is so powerful; you will only want to devour this book!

When I closed the book, I only wanted to jump in another marvellous book from KA. I know I said in my updates than the next one would probably be The Mystery Man or The Gamble but after I read Creed's blurb, I think I'm going to change my mind a continue with the Unfinished Heroes series ♥

Knight: 4.5 stars
Anya: 3 stars
Writing: 4 stars
Hotness: 5 stars






Auntee
1,355 reviews · 1,471 followers
May 7, 2016
I have to get my thoughts about this book down right now before time dilutes my feelings...it was fantastic! Oh, wowza! I'm not sure where to begin but here goes...

I haven't read every Kristen Ashley book that's out there, but I've read more than a handful. And with every KA book I've read, I know what to expect in the hero department. He's going to be an uber-Alpha, controlling, bossy, dominant, with secrets he's reluctant to reveal, but when he eventually does, you'll see a softer, more vulnerable side. Oh yeah, that was Mr. Knight Sebring alright. In real life, I could never see myself with a man like Knight--despite all his good points (and there were many) he was just way too controlling. So how did Kristen Ashley make me fall in love with him? Ahh, that's the beauty of her writing skills! Her characters absolutely put a spell on me, and make me think with my heart instead of my head.:) Knight was a page-turner from the get-go, and any book that holds my attention so much that it has me forgoing sleep is a winner for me!

Knight...


The plot is simple enough. Anya Gage is a 27-year old brunette beauty, holding down multiple jobs while attending beauty school with the goal of one day owning her own fabulous spa. It may be a pipe dream, but Anya's hard-working and independent, and no one deserves a break more than Anya. She meets 35 year-old club owner Knight at a party she's reluctantly attending with her gold-digger girlfriend Sandrine. Sandrine is interested in Nick Sebring (Knight's younger brother), a notorious Denver "player", and he's got bucks and connections. While at the party and looking for a way to leave, smokin' hot Knight walks in the door, all pissed off and badass becuase there's a party going on under his roof. Anya and Knight cross paths when she uses the phone to call a taxi and Knight insists on taking her home. Anya is attracted but a little scared of Knight, but he insists she has nothing to fear from him. That's the beginning of a relationship that changes Anya's whole life, as Knight becomes more and more a part of her world (or I should say she becomes a part of his world, because that's how it is with Knight). There's smokin' hot chemistry between the two, but will Anya be okay with giving up total control to Knight? Can she do what Knight wants, live with his rules, wear what he wants her to wear, ask no questions that he isn't ready to answer and abide by decisions he makes?

Knight has incredibly blue eyes...


Ms. Ashley gives us plenty of details about the characters. Anya's had a hard life since she was 7 years old, Knight, hoo boy, you have to wait awhile for the big reveal about his life, but it's a stunner. It explains soooo much about him and his actions. And he is so lucky to have found Anya; it takes a special woman to understand him and accept some of the things he does, all in the name of protecting those he cares about and his world. And as more and more of his secrets were exposed, and I grew to know (and love) him, I too felt understanding when the really big secret about how he makes his millions came out!

The love scenes? Ummmmmmm...smokin' H-O-T...but...the use of "Daddy" as in "Baby wants her Daddy" and "Daddy's gonna lick you clean" doesn't always work for me. But I can deal with it with characters this hot.:) Knight was a serious dirty-talker (which does
work for me) and was into a little of the kinky stuff (spanking) and some bondage, but a lot of this stuff was off the page. Fine by me. What was written was seriously hawt, so brace yourself.:)

And before I forget--the epilogue! Oh my...*swoon*...be prepared to get a little teary-eyed, is all I'll say. Just a wonderful HEA.

Knight just may have knocked At Peace off its pedestal as my favorite KA book. When you're sad because you've turned the last page and you're thinking about reading it again but this time really savoring it, then you know it's a winner. 5 big stars!

Sale Alert: 12Sept17 Kindle Daily Deal $1.59 This was my very first ever KA book that sent the ball rolling in the 50ish or so books I've read by her. She is totally my book crack.

3.5 Yeah Daddy Stars

Reread with my girls at Buddies Books and Baubles.

I might have liked this a smidge more on read #2

Mature content 18+

Knight is not your everyday hero. He is all man and knows exactly who he is, what he wants and what he expects from those around him. Things go his way and when they don’t he remedies that situation no matter who he has to hurt. Anya has been beaten down by others most her life. She lost her parents young and has never had anyone really care about or take care of her. She is self sufficient has her goals for her life and is working toward them. But when Knight starts doing things to take care of her without asking for anything in return she is drawn into him and his control.

“Wars fought over a face like this.” He murmured like he was talking to himself. My heart stopped beating and his thumbs moved lightly across my cheeks. “A man would work himself into the ground for it, go down to his knees to beg to keep it, endure torture to protect it, take a bullet for it,” his eyes came to mine, “poison his brother to possess a face like this.”

There are quite a few moments when Knight is endearing like this. But there are plenty of other moments when he is laying down the law. He is one of Kristen Ashley’s uber alpha males and as such he is sometimes a little over the top. He is in everyway a Dom and even though Anya has never had an experience in the role of submissive she finds that her introduction into his world to be exciting and maybe what she has always wanted.

”I have a new boyfriend. He’s awesome. Protective. And scary. And he regularly freaks me out by being all of those at once.”

Kristin Ashley(KA) is an author I have to be in the mood for. The OTT alphaness of the heroes of her series is something I crave at times, but I need to be in the mood for it or my feminism overtakes the enjoyment of the story. KA also has a tendency to use dialogue words that I think somewhat uncharacteristic of a romance. Okay, Yeah daddy, Good baby and Fuck me being the ones used the most in this novel. Also the lingo from Knight in this reminded me of maybe a New Jersey clipped dialect, or what I imagine that to me since I live in Utah and have no real idea how people from Jersey talk.

That said it really worked for Knight and the antihero he is. I don’t think I’ve ever read anything with a ‘Who’s your daddy’ type theme but remarkably it worked for this and I didn’t mind it at all, enjoyed many parts of it *feminist side hangs head in shame*. I liked the way that Knight treated Anya, she is precious to him and he would protect her from everything in the world if he could, including himself and her past demons.

No, Anya, no fucked up shit outta that sweet mouth. I’m not gonna listen to it and I’ll work my balls off, I don’t care if it takes decades, to make you stop even thinkin’ it. Instead, you gotta know that every second I spend with you it becomes more and more clear you were made for me. A gift I don’t deserve, didn’t earn, but I’m not giving it back.”

Knight is one of my new favorite antiheros (nobody beats Barrons from the fever Series) and this was an interesting look into a Dom/Sub relationship. I especially liked that all of the characters were late twenties early thirties and not tweens. When you are in the mood for a sexy antihero with OTT alphaness to him give Knight a try.
